Articles.Content: Floor 772: A secret alien planet is being discussed in this room. All of a sudden, a guard notices you. RUN!!!

Floor 773: A motorcycle roars past carrying a fifty sheep, a ladder, and a man British man yelling "Get yourselves organized down there!"

(+500000 points for whoever gets the reference)
Floor 774: You find yourself in an abandoned office, you walk out of door 427 when a voice says "All of his co-workers were gone, Jeb decided to walk to the meeting room to see if he missed a memo".
Floor 775: This level has been filled with sulfuric acid, and you dissolve. However, a new version of you regenerates on level 776.
Floor 776: There is nothing except for the stairway. Not even walls. It's really windy up here.
Floor 777: Immense luck is granted for you. Suddenly, a disembodied Kerbal head begins to orbit you.

Floor 787.

Captain Jonathan Archer has a hard time avoiding the building with USS Enterprise.
788: A pug wearing a tuxedo.
789: You see a person called "Seven" eating the No. 9 from Burger King.
790: Jeb tries to sell you the spacesuit and warns him of the upcoming levels, which may be more or less air-less.
791: there are random bodies of kerbals floating around
792: This level is actually airless. You should've bought Jeb's space suit.

Floor 793:

You find Toko Fukawa on this level. Needless to say, you run like hell, as Genocider Sho is not a girl you want to meet in a hurry.

794:

Mighty marshmallow man is greeting you on this level.
795:A tourist said: Come enjoy the Solar Flare!

796:

Several kraken victims walk out of the doors, prompting you to freak out and run to the next floor.
797: A plant shooting at a zombie.
798: A room made entirely of bacon. You don't leave this floor for five hundred years.
799: When you do, this is hollow.
800: A room full of spiders.
Floor 801: you see an elevator labelled "DOWN" and you ponder, but decide that you can't go down despite your fear of heights
Floor 802: You grab a space suit from the lockers here as the air is too thin.
Floor 803: You look up just in time to be able to duck under the ISS as it flies over you. The walls have holes that the ISS fits through. Good thing you brought the space suit.
804: You start to feel lighter. Your hair seems to have a mind of its own.
Floor 805: Adrien Brody is seen walking down this hallway.
